intro: Ione khasyana, commonly known as the Himalayan snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and slightly hairy, while its stems are slender and often branched. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are white or pale blue and are often clustered at the ends of the stems.
